snippet: The former Mets general manager Omar Minaya, now a top assistant for the San Diego Padres, expects players like Ike Davis, Lucas Duda, Kirk Nieuwenhuis and others to grow into a solid core.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column holds that several of the homegrown players in the New York Mets lineup are from the era of former New York Mets general manager Omar Minaya, who is now a top assistant for the San Diego Padres.
lead_paragraph: The former Mets general manager Omar Minaya, now a top assistant for the San Diego Padres, expects players like Ike Davis, Lucas Duda, Kirk Nieuwenhuis and others to grow into a solid core.

headline.seo: Minaya’s Imprint on the Mets Is Seen All Around the Diamond
headline.main: Minaya’s Imprint Is Seen All Over the Mets’ Lineup
headline.print_headline: Minaya’s Imprint Is Seen All Over The Mets’ Lineup
